required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Bcl-2 Inhibitor BGB-11417 in Participants With Mature B-Cell Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1a/1b Open-Label Dose Escalation and Expansion Study of Bcl-2 Inhibitor BGB-11417 in Patients With Mature B-Cell Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety, tolerability; Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D), optimal ramp-up dosing schedule; and to evaluate preliminary activity of BGB-11417 monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Number of Participants Experiencing Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Number of participants experiencing AEs leading to discontinuation of BGB-11417
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: 7. Phase 1a: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) as Assessed by the Safety Monitoring Committee (SMC)

Day 1 to last dose of study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Optimal ramp-up schedule of BGB-11417
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: A ramp-up schedule is defined as the BGB-11417 dosing schedule a participant utilizes to gradually reach or "ramp-up" to the intended target dose and schedule

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Overall Response Rate (ORR) as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after the last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of participants who had confirmed complete response Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from start of treatment to the first documentation of disease progression or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Duration of Response (DOR) as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from first determination of response until first documentation of progression or death

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Time to Response (TTR) as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from start of treatment to first documentation of response

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Overall survival (OS) as Assessed by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from start of treatment to the date of death due to any cause

arm_group.description: Dose Finding: Cohorts of participants with FL, DLBCL, MZL or transformed NHL, will receive oral BGB-11417 until the maximum tolerated and recommended phase 2 dose can be determined.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase 1b Part A (CLL/SLL Ramp-up) : BGB-11417 Monotherapy
arm_group.description: Ramp-Up Schedule Finding: Participants with CLL/SLL will receive oral BGB-11417 in various ramp-up schedules to determine optimum ramp-up schedule

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase 1b Part B (Expansion Cohorts): BGB-11417 Monotherapy
arm_group.description: Dose Expansion: Participants with CLL/SLL, FL, DLBCL, MZL or transformed NHL will receive recommended doses of oral BGB-11417 alone as determined from Phase 1a Dose Findings in parallel planned cohorts.

intervention.description: Administered as specified in the treatment arm
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 1b Part A (CLL/SLL Ramp-up) : BGB-11417 Monotherapy
Phase 1b Part B (Expansion Cohorts): BGB-11417 Monotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
Part 1 Marginal Zone lymphoma (MZL), follicular lymphoma (FL), diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) or transformed B-cell NHL (excluding Richters Transformation) that has relapsed or is refractory to at least 1 prior therapy
Part 2 (CLL/SLL Ramp-up):
Chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL/SLL) that relapsed or been refractory to at least 1 prior therapy
Part 2 (Expansion Cohorts):
Marginal Zone lymphoma (MZL), follicular lymphoma (FL), diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) or transformed B-cell NHL (excluding Richters Transformation) that has relapsed or is refractory to at least 1 prior therapy
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior malignancy within the past 2 years, except for curatively treated basal or squamous cell skin cancer, superficial bladder cancer, carcinoma in situ of the cervix or breast, or localized Gleason score 6 prostate
2. Known central nervous system (CNS) involvement by lymphoma/leukemia
3. Known plasma cell neoplasm, prolymphocytic leukemia, history of or currently suspected Richter's syndrome
4. Prior autologous stem cell transplant unless â‰¥ 3 months after transplant
5. Prior allogeneic stem cell transplant
NOTE: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
